sub_title: Time to Think Coach | Facilitator of Meetings | Business Anthropologist | Yoga & Meditation
summary:
As a business anthropologist, I focus on helping companies inspire and convince Americans, to listen carefully and to truly understand their business culture so it will lead to better results.

As a listening coach, I focus on helping anyone who needs to think deeply about their questions and challenges they want answered.

Inspire & Convince Americans
With an understanding of American business culture and people, you can anticipate what is most likely to happen. Situations, people, their reactions and actions will become more understandable to you. You will be able to interpret what was said as it was intended and anticipate and adapt your reactions accordingly. You will be able to see the person behind your American interlocutors. For more information about this online training and bi-weekly supervision by Marjoleine, please check www.4cunity.com.

Think deeply for yourself
By listening to yourself, you can better understand your assumptions, thoughts, feelings and actions. They are interconnected and you can affect them positively. By easing your mind and listening to yourself first, you can better listen to others and truly understand them. With really listening to others, you will improve their thinking and your own. Thinking deeply in a safe and quiet space with the right preconditions provides pure and enlightening insights, directions, messages, presentations, answers, ideas, solutions and innovations. I will help you tap into your resourcefulness and that of others with listening and coaching.
For more information about coaching sessions, please check www.4cunity.com.

education.degree_name: 2-day Time to Think Foundation Programme Course

education.grade: CCE International Coach Federation 21,5 Coaching Specific Hours & 2 Resource Dev

education.field_of_study: Culture, Organization and Management, social-cultural sciences

profile_positions.description:
* 4c Unity specializes in coaching people to listen to their authentic selves and to others in order to bring out the best in both. Through deep listening, people build a relationship of trust. In the relationship, possibilities emerge, leading to successful results. To properly interpret the message of colleagues, customers, suppliers and partners, you need to know the key aspects of his or her cultural background and be able to adapt your message accordingly, while remaining yourself. With respect for yourself and the other.
* 4c Unity also offers coaching in self-awareness and self-confidence to stand strong and communicate clear messages and convince others (regardless of their cultural background). Listening inwardly and tapping into your gut feelings is achieved through breathing exercises and questioning negative assumptions about yourself and others and replacing them with neutral or positive ones.
* 4c Unity specializes in online training and coaching to improve cooperation with Americans.
profile_positions.title: Coach and trainer

profile_positions.description:
Get support from Americans to turn your ideas into realities.
You need the right arguments in order to convince Americans, because persuasion is cultural-based.
Improve your work relationship and cooperation with Americans, so you can be both successfull.
profile_positions.title: Online training: Inspire & Convince Americans

profile_positions.description:
Training in cultural sensitivity and communication skills
I gave several trainings on cultural sensitivity and communications skills (in one) which are essential to have in order to deal with complex international work situation of clients. The starting point of the training is the client and his or her difficult work situation. Tailor made trainings.

Several complex situations of clients:
- Americans who interrupt too fast so you can't do your proposal as a Dutch, French, German, ... person.  How to grab their attention and convince them? 
- French colleagues who won't fill in reports (to ensure structure and one way of working during projects). How to work with them with respect for their way of working and yours?
- Gemans whose leadership is too authoritative for others. How to manage people coming from a less authoritative culture and still making sure the job is done?
- Dutch who are complaining and negative. How to filter and how to win them for your ideas?
-  How to make contact with Russian people and work with them?
- etc

 I've talked to clients and made a diagnoses of their complex situations. Based on that I 've made tailor made trainings. At the end of the training they were able to work with the cases they are dealing with in their international work environment. They have cultural sensitivity skills and communication skills. They learned about it, understood why they are doing the way they do, how they can adjust with respect for themselves and others. And they practised with the new behaviour (with  short checklists), so they can use and apply it the next day on the job. 

Happy to discover that during my cultural communication skills trainings everything I've learned and experienced comes together and works out well. My background in communications, firm anthropology, EFT therapy, coaching, training and even yoga. I am thankful for the chances and choices I've made and the people I've met. Looking forward to all inspiring years to come.
profile_positions.title: Owner

profile_positions.description:
Yoga
Af en toe neem ik yogalessen over. Het is heel fijn om hetgeen ik zelf ervaar met anderen te mogen delen. Om mensen tijdens houdingen, te laten ontspannen. Dus om te ontspannen in de spanning. Om zich daar niet tegen te verzetten, maar om het te accepteren. Dan komt er ruimte en lenigheid. Blokkades in het lichaam en de geest worden opgeheven. Het is rustgevend om met de ademhaling ruimte in het lichaam te maken en rust te ervaren. Heel hard nodig in deze hectiek; even bij jezelf komen en aan jezelf toe komen. Hoe meer je dat op de mat oefent, hoe meer je dat toepast in je dagelijkse leven als je van de mat afstapt. Het geeft voldoening om mensen 'hoog' binnen te zien komen, vol in de actie en in het hoofd, en weer gegrond en vol energie de les uit te zien gaan.
profile_positions.title: Owner

profile_positions.description:
Training in intercultural awareness
Over the years I gave intercultural awareness trainings for several diverse groups working with people with other cultural backgrounds. Tailored preventative and problem solving intercultural awareness trainings. For example how to work with the Dutch, Germans, French, English, Russians, Brazilians, Americans, the Chinese, Indians people. The Do's and Don'ts.
profile_positions.title: Owner

profile_positions.description:
EFT coach
I gave Emotionally Focused Couple Therapy to couples as a Basis Therapist/Coach
profile_positions.title: Owner

profile_positions.description:
Communications
- 4CUnity was asked by Royal Dutch Kentalis to write an internal communication plan and to advise on external communication regarding an organization wide transition program. The assignment lasted 11 months.
- As requested by steering group Taalspraak, 4CUnity created a website structure to inform parents and caretakers about language and speech. 
- 4CUnity was asked by Viataal to write a marketing communication plan for the expansion of their business (Audiological and Diagnostic Center) and developed -together with employees and managers- a SWOT analysis to retrieve and communicate Unique Selling Points. Employees of the Audiological and Diagnostic Center executed the plan. The assignement took 5 and a half months.
- 4CUnity replaced a communication advisor of Viataal who is on maternity leave. It lasted 5 months. Marjoleine van Sinderen continued all communication projects in the area. She advised the Area Director and developed a communication plan for customer participation. She wrote articles for the internal magazine, external magazine and Intranet. She was also responsible for production of these means of communication.
- As requested by Heidenhain Eindhoven, 4CUnity organized an intercultural training for it’s employees. During the 4 hours training, intercultural differences and similarities between the Dutch, the Germans and the Swiss were discussed. Heidenhain employees are now able to understand their own Dutch culture (norms an values) better, as well as the behavior and responses of their foreign colleagues.
profile_positions.title: Owner

profile_positions.description:
Communications
- For 6 weeks 4CUnity helped Royal Dutch Kentalis in the International Department with communication tasks like writing and translating website texts and coordination.
- During 3 months 4CUnity acted as Communication Advisor of Royal Dutch Kentalis in the Expertise and Innovation Department (E&I) and for the Board of Management. 
- Marjoleine temporarily replaced the Communication Advisor of Royal Dutch Kentalis in the Expertise and Innovation Department (E&I) during 6 months. Marjoleine advised the E&I Management team on internal and external positioning, for both long and short term projects. She also gave recommendations to employees, wrote communication plans and implemented these in close cooperation with project leaders. Her contribution varied from writing press releases and articles to representing Kentalis on the Multilingual Conference.
- As requested by NXP Semiconductors Central R&D, Foundation Technology, Design Methods group in Eindhoven, 4CUnity organized an intercultural training for it’s employees. During the 2 hours training, intercultural differences and similarities between the Dutch, the Germans, the French, the Russians, the Americans, the Chinees, the Indians, the Serbs, the Turkish and other nationalities were discussed. The employees are now able to understand their own Dutch culture (norms an values) better, as well as the behavior and responses of their foreign colleagues.
profile_positions.title: Owner

profile_positions.description:
As part of a project group, 4CUnity organized the internal information market of Sint Marie.

Sint Marie, center for communication, and her new partners wanted to present themselves to their joint employees. 4CUnity therefore asked employees of Sint Marie to present their services and products at stands during an information market.

Marjoleine van Sinderen was responsible for managing this project (coordination, implementation, administration) and she created means of communication. She was also laterally involved with production of an internal promotion film.
profile_positions.title: Communication and project management

profile_positions.location: Caen Area, France and Eindhoven Area, The Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the implementation of the Governance model in cooperation with other team members.
o	Improve definitions of Governance bodies, roles and responsibilities. 
o	Get project structure and tools in place.
o	Improve the Business Balance Scorecard.
o	Implement decision-supporting tools. 
o	Implement process maps in place.
o	Monitor the progress of the Governance implementation. 
o	Measure the awareness and involvement of employees regarding the Governance by means of a survey.
o	Ensure Governance is accepted and followed within the PLT sector.
o	Direct the process of employees adding their roles & responsibilities in their PPM (individual appraisal system).
profile_positions.title: Project leader Governance
